header.title: Hagur Sinister Tarot: The Major Arcana For Pathworking and Visualisation

central_thesis: The book presents a practical system for self-transformation and empowerment through the visualization and invocation of specific 'Dark Gods' and entities, utilizing a distinct Major Arcana Tarot deck called the 'Hagur Sinister Tarot.' This system is framed within the initiatory and philosophical context of the Sinister Pathway Triangle Order (SPTO), a group explicitly linked to the broader Order of Nine Angles (ONA) tradition of Traditional Satanism, emphasizing the development of 'sinister impulse' and the 'Abyssal Mind' for personal apotheosis.

structure_content.summary: Introduces The Sinister Pathway Triangle Order (SPTO) as an occult group of Satanists working in 'Black Chambers' and outlines the four core requirements for an adept: enquiring the Sinister Pathway, obeying inward sinister impulses (including developing instinct, controlling mind, cultivating passion, selfish aspiration, and urging 'Dark Gods' emanations), disregarding external considerations, and living the Sinister Life fully while maintaining secrecy of the Satanic Philosophy to outsiders.

A poetic text describing an initiatory journey into 'Abyssal Life,' emphasizing death of the old self and transformation. It details a quest for self-reliance, self-love, and self-power, culminating in the presence of 'Dark Light' and a declaration of attained power and respect. The poem mentions the 'Tree of Wyrd' and includes invocations like 'Agios O Vindex, enter the sphere of Chaos' and 'Agios O Satanas,' underscoring themes of destruction, creation, and self-deification.

Defines 'agitation' as an aggregation of dark energies structured to express a 'creative Magician's' thought. It provides specific daily 'Words of Power' to be chanted from the 'Abyssal Mind' towards the four cardinal directions, invoking the 'Dark God Atazoth' (meaning 'an increasing of azoth'). These chants involve dedication, consecration, the phrase 'destroy and build' (associated with a reversed pentagram), and a declaration of service to Atazoth.

Continues the daily exercise with a powerful declaration of self-mastery and divine identity: 'I am the Power, I am the Glory, I am another God.' It concludes with further invocations, 'Agios O Vindex' and 'Agios O Satanas,' and instructs that all rituals are preferably performed outdoors or within one's 'Black Chamber.'

Outlines the prerequisites for successful hermetic magick, which heavily rely on 'visualization and vibration' skills. It provides a detailed, step-by-step invocation ritual for 'Major Arcana Cards.' This ritual includes calling an entity, visualizing desire, performing a circular dance to achieve ecstasy, chanting 'I am the power, I am the glory, I am a god!', allowing the mind to fill with images, and linking the experience to the appropriate Tarot image.

Presents 22 illustrated Tarot cards, each with a numerical designation (0-XXI), a traditional title (e.g., 'The Magickian,' 'The High Priestess'), and a unique 'Sinister' entity or concept name (e.g., Physis-Ga Wath Am, Binan Ath, Mactoron, Atazoth, Satanas-Azoth, Vindex, Nythra, Noctulius, Gaubni). Many cards also include corresponding planetary or alchemical symbols and a copyright/date.

A diagram mapping the 22 Major Arcana cards as 'paths' and various entities/concepts as 'spheres' onto a unique cosmological structure, conceptually similar to the Qabalistic Tree of Life but employing distinct nomenclature for spheres (e.g., Saturn, Mars, Mercury, Moon, Sun, Jupiter, Venus) and integrating the 'Hidden Pathways' of the system. This provides a structural framework for understanding the interconnections of the Hagur Sinister Tarot.

A statement from Anton Long of the Order of Nine Angles (ONA) asserting that copyright is an 'anachronistic concept' for ONA material, advocating for its free and accurate distribution without profit. It clarifies that only material reproduced exactly as originally released by ONA is considered authentic, but publishers are free to add their own artwork or presentation provided it is clearly marked as non-ONA material.

key_concepts.definition: An occult group comprised of three Satanists who work together on the subjective plane in their 'Black Chamber' or in physical gatherings. It serves as the organizational and philosophical context for the practices described.

A dedicated ritual space, either subjective (meditative/astral) or physical, where Satanists of the SPTO conduct their occult workings and rituals to achieve self-realization and connect with 'Dark Gods'.

The esoteric knowledge and understanding integral to the Sinister Pathway. It is pursued by adepts for self-mastery and the development of their inner 'sinister impulses,' leading to a distinct, non-conventional worldview.

An inherent inward drive or instinct cultivated by the Satanist, enabling them to perceive beyond conventional societal norms ('the fogs and miasmas of present world conditions of multiracialism') and guiding them towards self-realization and power.

Powerful entities or archetypes whose emanations and energies are consciously invited and unfolded by adepts within themselves. This process is crucial for personal transformation and the manifestation of desired changes in reality.

A specific 'Dark God' frequently invoked in the 'Dark Exercises.' The term itself is explicitly defined as meaning 'an increasing of azoth,' suggesting an augmentation of primordial, potent, and transformative energy or lifeforce.

A technical term defined as 'an aggregation of dark energies arranged in a certain form as that which follows, in order to express the idea of some creative Magician (Thinker), and qualified or characterised by the nature of his thought and held in that peculiar form as long as his thoughts remain sinisterly dynamic.' It consists of four components: the thinker, the potency, the quality of that potency, and the agitation itself.

The primary practical methods for engaging with the Hagur Sinister Tarot. Pathworking involves mentally traversing the symbolic landscapes of the cards and the 'Tree of Wyrd,' while visualization is the imaginative construction and holding of desired outcomes and entity forms to facilitate magical operations.

A unique Major Arcana Tarot deck comprising 22 cards. Each card features specific imagery, a traditional title, and an associated 'Sinister' entity or concept, serving as focal points for invocation, visualization, and pathworking within the SPTO system.

The cosmological framework of the Hagur Sinister Tarot system, analogous to the Qabalistic Tree of Life. It maps the Major Arcana cards as 'paths' connecting various 'spheres' or sephiroth, which are identified with specific planetary influences and Sinister entities, illustrating the energetic and symbolic interrelations of the system.

practical_system.description: The practical system revolves around using the 'Hagur Sinister Tarot' Major Arcana for 'Pathworking and Visualisation' within the initiatory context of the Sinister Pathway Triangle Order (SPTO). It emphasizes the development of visualization and 'vibration' skills as foundational for all magical operations. The system incorporates daily 'Dark Exercises' involving specific chants and invocations directed towards the 'Dark God Atazoth' from cardinal directions, culminating in a declaration of self-deification. The core invocation ritual guides the practitioner to call upon specific 'entities' associated with the Tarot cards to manifest personal desires, aiming to achieve an ecstatic state that facilitates magical will and manifestation.
tools: The Hagur Sinister Tarot Major Arcana deck (specifically the 22 illustrated cards).
A 'Black Chamber' (a dedicated ritual space, which can be either subjective/astral or a physical location).
Knowledge of the 'Tree of Wyrd' and its associated correspondences, which provides the cosmological map for effective pathworking and understanding of the system's energetics.
rituals: **Daily Dark Exercises**: A four-part directional invocation of 'Atazoth' using distinct phrases ('Agios O Atazoth,' 'I dedicate and consecrate myself to the powerful Dark God Atazoth,' 'destroy and build' (in conjunction with a reversed pentagram), and 'I serve Atazoth'), followed by a personal declaration of power, concluding with 'Agios O Vindex, Agios O Satanas.' These rituals are preferably performed outside or in a 'Black Chamber.'

**Invocation Ritual for Tarot Entities**: A step-by-step process involving: 1. Uttering a direct call to a specific entity ('Come......... [entity name] to me! And bring me my desire!'). 2. Briefly visualizing the desired outcome and verbalizing a protective phrase. 3. Engaging in a slow, circular dance in the opposite direction, laughing until achieving an ecstatic state. 4. Chanting 'I am the power, I am the glory, I am a god!' during ecstasy. 5. Allowing the mind to freely generate images and feelings. 6. Concluding the ritual by stating, 'It is completed.' 7. Linking the entire experience to the corresponding Hagur Sinister Tarot image.

relevant_quotes.text: The Sinister Pathway Order is constituted of many but separate groups of three Satanists working together on the subjective plane alone in their own Black Chamber, or all the three of them when they gather.

To become an adept of the SPTO it will be necessary for the inquirer to: (1) Enquire the Sinister Pathway... (2) Obey his inward sinister impulses... (3) Pay no attention to any outside consideration... (4) Live the Sinister Life fully.

This arduous task in self-realisation is as follows: (a) Development of instinct and intuition. (b) The control of Higher (Deeper) and ordinary mind. (c) Cultivating passion and sinister impulse. (d) Selfish aspiration and sinister incentive. (e) Urging the emanations of the Dark Gods and the unfoldment of their energies in themselves.

Through initiation the dark angel enters the Abyssal Life, And knows it to be death... I look in this kingdom to find Self-reliance, self-love, and self-power, To prove myself and reveal my power. Dark Light is present, Power and respect is now mine, Cast me never out.

As from the Tree of Wyrd, the spheres of darkness, Twenty-one vibrating and shaking voices are heard: Agios O Vindex, enter the sphere of Chaos, Join into the dance, this universe is yours... Destroy and Create. Agios O Satanas

A agitation is an aggregation of dark energies arranged in a certain form as that which follows, in order to express the idea of some creative Magician (Thinker), and qualified or characterised by the nature of his thought and held in that peculiar form as long as his thoughts remain sinisterly dynamic.

When this is done, one can say: With desire and freedom now I stand, I live and die, am offered up and rise again, I come and go at will. From the Abyss I stand, My fire destroys that which impedes my way, And Master of the Earth am I... "I am the Power, I am the Glory, I am another God"
Successful hermetic magick depends to a large extent on the abilities of visualization and vibration, and before any workings are undertaken practice in both should be undertaken.

Say: 'Come......... (here name the entity) to me! And bring me my desire!' Briefly visualize your desire... Then begin a slow circular dance in the opposite direction, laughing while you dance until you fall in ecstasy, saying: 'I am the power, I am the glory, I am a god!'... Try and link your feelings during the working with the appropriate Tarot image.

critical_analysis.relevance: This work is highly relevant to students and practitioners of Traditional Satanism, particularly those engaged with the Order of Nine Angles (ONA) and its specific magical methodologies. It offers a concrete example of a custom Tarot deck designed to integrate with a distinct ONA-related cosmology (the Tree of Wyrd) and a unique operative system of self-empowerment, invocation, and 'sinister' pathworking. It effectively demonstrates the fusion of elements from ceremonial magic (directional invocations, words of power, ecstatic states) with a pronounced Left-Hand Path philosophy, emphasizing individual will, radical self-deification, and the conscious cultivation of 'dark energies' for personal and external change.
critical_analysis.target_audience: The primary target audience consists of experienced practitioners within the Order of Nine Angles (ONA) and Traditional Satanism, as well as advanced students of the Left-Hand Path who are already familiar with its underlying philosophy, cosmology, and specialized terminology. It also holds value for academic researchers studying contemporary Satanism, modern occult currents, or the adaptation of traditional esoteric tools like Tarot within specific magical traditions. Due to its specialized concepts, explicit 'sinister' orientation, and assumed prior knowledge, it is not suitable for beginners in occult studies.
